result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert J. Nitka

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:02 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Robert J. Nitka.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appears by authorization. Atty. Wolff provides an update; he has discovery but just received an offer and needs time to review it with his client.  Atty. Wolff requests another further proceedings date in about 3 weeks.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on October 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:36 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Robert J. Nitka.  Attorney appears by authorization. Atty. Wolff provides an update; he is still waiting on an offer from the State.  State notes it will route the file to the ADA assigned to get defense an offer.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on September 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

NEW CONDITIONS ORDERED ON 08/22/2022: Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim A/ listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

9:13 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Robert J. Nitka in court.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Robert J. Nitka.  Atty. Wolff notes that there is a bail motion he filed, and the victim was supposed to be by Zoom, but he does not appear to be present at this time.  State advises that with the specific bail request their office has not been able to discuss it with the victim.  State would want to hear from the victim first before proceeding on defense's bail motion.  Atty. Wolff requests the court call the victim to allow him to appear by phone.  Court will allow.  Victim A appears by telephone at 9:16 a.m.  Court has a colloquy with the Victim with respect to the motion to modify bail.  State will stay silent with respect to the bail motion.  Based on no objection from the Victim Court will grant the Motion to Modify bail to amend the condition to be no violent contact with Victim A; all other conditions to remain as previously set.  Atty. Wolff provides an update, he is requesting another further proceedings in about 30 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Filed by Atty. Wolff.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Filed by Atty. Wolff.

records.addlTxt: Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant allowed one trip to the residence accompanied by a peace/police officer to obtain personal items.  If Victim A is present at the residence, the defendant may not be there but if Victim A is not at the residence, the defendant may be there.

01:35 PM Defendant Robert J. Nitka in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Posted on 07-20-2022

03:27 PM Defendant Robert J. Nitka not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Niki Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court received notice from the jail that the defendant is not currently in custody.
